Translations.Text: Their eyes will be cast down, humiliation will cover them; because they used to be called to prostrate (offer prayers), and they were healthy and good (in the world, but they refused to do so)
Then (O Muhammad) leave Me Alone with those who deny this speech (Qur’an). We shall punish them gradually from where they don’t perceive
And I will (even) grant them a respite. Surely, My plan is strong
Or have you (O Muhammad) asked them a wage, so they are heavily burdened from debt
Or do they have the (knowledge of the) unseen with them, so they can write it down

So wait with patience for the decision of your Lord, and don’t be like the companion of the fish (reference to Prophet Jonah who was swallowed by a fish), who cried out (to Us) while he was in distress
Had not a Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been (left in the stomach of the fish, but We forgave him, so he was) cast off on the naked shore, while he was blamed
But his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous
And surely, the disbelievers would almost make you slip with their eyes (through hatred) when they hear the reminder (the Qur’an), and they say: “Surely, he (Muhammad) is a madman!”
This (the Qur’an) is nothing but a reminder to all people of the worlds
The inevitable (of the Day of Resurrection)
And what will make you understand what the inevitable is
Thamud and Ad people denied the calamity (the striking Hour of judgment)
As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the awful cry
As for Ad, they were destroyed by a furious violent wind
which Allah imposed on them for 7 nights and 8 days in succession, so that you could see the people lying overthrown (destroyed) in it as if they were hollow trunks of date-palms
Now, do you see any remnants of them
